subject: Plus X VAM motors not working
description_text:
Hello, I tried my new Plus X pedals today and the pedals are working ok but
the vam linear motors are not working and are not recognised in Simsonn
manager. I am using the latest Simsonn manager, I have updated firmware
automatically and manually finding the plus X sfu file in the folder. I
have 2 motors and I have tried plugging them into all 3 inputs on the pedal
box. I am using a blue USB port on the back of my PC. In Simsonn manager it
says 'power disconnect' in red and all the settings below it are not able
to be clicked. How can this be resolved quickly?

Thank you
Liam Hutchinson

Order number: #SSN3335 (AliExpress)

conversations.body_text: Hi Liam Hutchinson,    Your order from the standalone site includes two VAM Pro units and a 24V power supply.  Have your two motors and the 24V power supply been connected? Please send me photos of the motors and the control unit installation for inspection. Also, provide screenshots of the pedals and vibration feedback interface in SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 so I can check the firmware version.  The latest firmware versions are: CPU1: 2.0.5 CPU2: 2.0.4
I've attached the photos. Everything is connected.

Hi Liam Hutchinson,     The images I received are incomplete, so I cannot confirm whether the 24V power supply is properly connected to the main controller. Please try updating the controller firmware. If the vibration motor still shows as disconnected after the update, we will send you a replacement main controller.      Please uninstall your current software version first, then download and install SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 from the official website link below.  Next, in the software, navigate to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals‑firmware → pedals‑plusx.sfu  After the firmware update is complete, run a test to verify that the functions are working correctly. Please perform the test again after the update.     https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download

The 24V power supply is plugged into DC input on the main controller.
Please see the attached photos demonstrating that I uninstalled Simsonn
manager, downloaded Simsonn manager 2.1.2 again from Simsonn website,
installed it, updated firmware manually, and the vam motors still show
power disconnect.

It is worth noting that when I did manual firmware update, the throttle
pedal became very laggy and the usb kept disconnecting. I manually updated
the firmware again and now it is working properly again, but still no vam
motor.

Thank you.
